The expert: s claim was further supported by the fact that emergency room costs represent a relatively small percentage (2 percent) of overall health care spending. This aspect helped to emphasize the insignificance of emergency room costs in the larger context of health care expenditures.
The credibility of the Medical Expenditu: Austin Frakt of Boston University and Katherine Baicker of the Harvard School of Public Health vouched for the credibility of the survey, adding weight to the authenticity of the claim.
